details.title: Early pics from UP's Saharanpur
details.content:
Saharanpur: Polling begins at booth number no 349, located at J. B. Jain Degree College. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/KQ8AFzTH2z

details.title: Urge voters to to turn out in record numbers and exercise their franchise: PM Modi
details.content: "Lok Sabha Elections 2019 commence today. I call upon all those whose constituencies are voting in the first phase today to turn out in record numbers and exercise their franchise. I specially urge young and first-time voters to vote in large numbers", said PM Modi in his appeal to nation.

details.title: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat casts his vote
details.content: "Voting is our duty, everyone should vote", Bhagwat said after exercising his franchise.

details.title: Check out which constituencies are going to polls in phase one
Flower petals showered to welcome voters in UP
details.content:
Baghpat: Flower petals being showered and dhol being played to welcome voters at polling booth number 126 in Baraut. pic.twitter.com/vszxzuYLlz

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) April 11, 2019

details.title: 91 constituencies to decide on their MPs in phase one
details.content: In today's phase one of the General elections, voters from 91 parliamentary constituencies spread across 18 states and 2 Union Territories will be exercising their franchise to vote. Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Uttarakhand, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim, Lakshadweep and Andaman and the Nicobar Islands will be completing their voting in a single phase today.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu and family cast their votes
details.content:
Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and his family after casting their vote for #LokSabhaElections2019 in Amravati. pic.twitter.com/QzlYYfNzjd

— ANI (@ANI) April 11, 2019

details.content:

People are looking for a change, Vote without fear: YSRCP chief Jagan
details.content:
YSR Congress Party Chief Jagan Mohan Reddy after casting his votes in Kadapa says he is very confident, people are looking for a change, vote without fear.

Andhra Pradesh is simultanously voting for both State Assembly and Lok Sabha in today's phase one elections.

details.title: Opposition alliance, caste equation, Modi factor make UP battle interesting
details.content: Two interrelated questions — has the Modi wave waned or persistent in the state and will the maha-gathbandhan halt the BJP winning spree in the state since 2014 — merit immediate attention. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Poll bandwagon skips ailing Vidarbha

details.title: It’s going to be a positive pro-incumbency vote: Prakash Javadekar
details.content: In 2014, people voted with hope; this time they will vote with confidence for the BJP because voters know Narendra Modi is the only leader who can take the country towards holistic development, Union Human Resource Development Minister Prakash Javadekar says in an interview with the TNIE. (READ THE FULL INTERVIEW HERE)

details.title: Nationalism pitch of BJP finds favour in Uttarakhand
details.content: The BJP’s nationalism pitch dominates the electoral discourse in Uttarakhand whereas the Congress plank of minimum income guarantee has seemingly antagonised the middle-class electorate in the hill state. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Technical glitches test voter patience in Andhra Pradesh

details.title: It's a hot sunny election day for Telangana
details.content:
Temperature in most places of Telangana is between 39-42 degree Celsius. 

Parts of Adilabad, Nirmal, Nizamabad & Siricilla districts record above 42 deg Cel.

Jainad in Adilabad records scorching 43.4 deg Cel.

In Hyderabad 38-40 deg Cel

details.title: IED blast in Chhattisgarh; 4 Maoists held
details.content: Naxals triggered an IED blast on Thursday morning in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district in Bastar Lok Sabha constituency where voting is underway. Narayanpur comes under the Bastar Lok Sabha seat. Meanwhile, four Maoists were arrested and three firearms seized from them in Bijapur district under the same constituency.

details.title: Names of many voters missing from list
details.content:
Scores of voters turned away after their names found missing. Manoj Kumar from Nizampet was told his name is in Madhapur. Another voter found his name but his wife's name was missing. Plenty complaints regarding no distribution of slips. #LokSabhaElections2019 @NewIndianXpress

— sadaf aman (@amansadaf) April 11, 2019

details.title: Voters shocked to find names deleted from list in Hyderabad
details.content:
Anish, took some time off from office and came all the way from Jubilee Hills to Kachiguda to cast his vote. However his enthusiasm to participate in the 'festival of democracy' got dented as he found his name missing in electoral rolls. @NewIndianXpress #Telangana #Election2019 pic.twitter.com/Cn82z8viWs

— Nilesh TNIE (@Nilesh_TNIE) April 11, 2019

details.title: Uniformed people coercing people to vote for BJP, alleges NC, PDP
details.content: The National Conference and the PDP on Thursday alleged that uniformed personnel coerced people to vote for the BJP and EVMs malfunctioned in some places with the Congress button not working during the first phase of polling in Jammu's Poonch area. PDP president Mehbooba Mufti tweeted a video showing voters raising anti-BJP slogans after they were purportedly roughed up by the BSF for not voting for the BJP.

details.title: Filed complaints regarding EVM malfunctioning: Congress
details.content: The Congress sent 39 complaints to the EC about "glitches" in the functioning of EVMs at some booths in six Lok Sabha seats of Maharashtra where polling was underway.

details.title: Sonia files nomination from Rae Bareli
details.content: UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi files nomination from Rae Bareli parliamentary constituency (Photo | EPS)

details.title: 40.34 per cent voter turnout in Arunachal Pradesh; 3 injured in a clash during polling
details.content: At least three persons were seriously injured in a clash between supporters of two rival political parties under Tali assembly constituency in Kurung Kumey district of Arunachal Pradesh during polling on Thursday, police said. Meanwhile, the voter turnout in the state was 40.34 per cent till 1 pm.

details.title: WATCH | Security personnel fire shots in the air to stop those trying to vote without an ID in UP
details.content:
#WATCH Security personnel fired shots in air after some ppl tried to cast vote without voter ID at a polling station in Shamli. District Magistrate says,“BSF personnel, fired in air for security reasons after some ppl without voter ID tried to cast vote. Voting has resumed now." pic.twitter.com/iXRkS6xFaD

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) April 11, 2019

details.title: Odisha records 41 per cent voter turnout in 1st phase till 1 pm
details.content: Despite initial hiccups of delay in voting due to technical glitches in EVMs at a few places, polling is going on smoothly in Odisha's four parliamentary constituencies - Kalahandi, Nabarangpur, Berhampur and Koraput. The state recorded a voter turnout of  41 per cent till 1 pm. (READ HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Two dead in poll-related violence between YSRC and TDP workers
Congress claims threat to Rahul Gandhi in Amethi
details.content: Congress says laser, possibly from a sniper gun, was pointed at Rahul on at least 7 separate occasions, while he was addressing the media after filing nomination from Amethi.

details.title: Have not received any complaint regarding breach of security of Rahul: MHA
details.content: We have not received any letter regarding alleged breach in security of Congress President Rahul Gandhi. As soon as our attention was drawn to reports of incident of “green light” being pointed at him in Amethi, the Director (SPG) was asked to verify factual position, says MHA

details.title: Green light that fell on Rahul during his Amethi press meet came from camera: MHA
details.content: We have been informed by Director SPG that the “green light” shown in clipping was found to be that of a mobile phone used by AICC photographer, who was video graphing the impromptu press interaction of Rahul Gandhi near the collectorate in Amethi.

details.title: Three dead after tractor in which voters were travelling overturned in Maharashtra
details.content: Three dead, nine injured after tractor overturned near Shankarpur village in Gadchiroli on Thursday. The victims were returning to their village after casting their votes.

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir records voter turnout of over 35 per cent
details.content: Amid protests over defective EVMs in J&K, Jammu and Baramulla constituencies record a voter turnout of 35 per cent till 1 pm.

details.title: Quick facts about phase one of Lok Sabha elections
details.content:
• Constituencies: 91 Lok Sabha constituencies spread across 18 states and two Union territories.
     
  • Total number of polling stations: 1,70,664
     
  • In Mizoram, 15 special polling booths have been set up in Kanhmun at Mizoram-Tripura border for Bru (Reang) refugees who are living in camps in Tripura.
     
  • Mizoram also holds the unique distinction among the parliamentary constituencies with 100 per cent voters having Electors Photo Identity Card (EPIC). 
     
  • 52 per cent voters in Meghalaya are women. 
     
  • Over 142,054,000 voters to decide fate of 1,279 candidates in the 91 constituencies. 
     
  • 7,764 'third gender' voters eligible to cast ballots 
     
  • Voting for 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th and 7th phase of the elections will take place on April 18, April 23, April 29, May 6, May 12 and May 19, respectively.
     
  • The counting of votes to constitute the 17th Lok Sabha will take place on May 23.

(Source: PTI)

details.title: Tainted candidates all!
details.content:
Of the 1279 candidates contesting seats in 91 constituencies in Phase 1, the National Election Watch and Association for Democratic Reforms went through the self-sworn affidavits of 1,266 candidates. 

Of the candidates 225 were from national parties and 124 from state parties.

Almost 1/6th of the candidates, 213 out of the 1279 had criminal cases against their name, including murder cases, kidnapping charges, crime against women and hate speech.

details.title: Naxals trigger IED blast near polling booth in Maharashtra
details.content: Naxals triggered an IED blast near a polling booth in Maharashtra's Gadchroli district Thursday while voting for the Lok Sabha poll was underway. No casualties have been reported so far.

details.title: Five Assam schools served show-cause notices for violating MCC
details.content: The district election officer of Hailakandi has issued show cause notices to five schools for violating the model code of conduct (MCC) by sending students to Congress president Rahul Gandhi's rally at Panchgram. (READ HERE)

details.title: From poll violence to EVM malfunctioning, here's a look at the ongoing Lok Sabha elections
details.content:
⚡️ From poll violence to EVM malfunctioning, here's a look at the ongoing #IndiaElections2019. #ElectionsWithTNIE #VotingRound1 @Kalyan_TNIE @Rahul_TNIE https://t.co/eFArEYRGtU

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) April 11, 2019

details.title: UP police stop Dalit voters from reaching poll booths: BSP
details.content: We are receiving information from various polling stations that BSP voters, specially Dalits, are being stopped from reaching polling booths by use of force by UP police. All this is apparently being done on diktat of higher-ups. Immediate intervention is required: BSP writes to Election Commission

details.title: BJP violated EC guidelines by holding press meet on Thursday: BJD
details.content:
Biju Janata Dal (BJD) writes to Chief Electoral Officer, Bhubaneswar, over violation of EC guidelines by BJP for holding press meet today and details of the same being provided on scrolling news on OTV. We demand strict action be taken against BJP, its leaders & OTV. #Odisha pic.twitter.com/Kg59HPDCd1

— ANI (@ANI) April 11, 2019

details.title: Ensure convicts on parole do not indulge in election-related activities, EC directs states
details.content: The Election Commission has directed states that parole should be granted to imprisoned convicts during the ongoing poll season only in cases of 'extreme emergency' but it should be ensured that they do not participate in election-related affairs.

details.title: Gender wise voting percentage finds women participation has increased over the years, will the trend continue?
details.content:
Gender wise voting percentage from 3rd to 16th general elections; women participation has been increased over the years. 65.30% of the women voters participated in 2014 elections.#LokSabhaElections2019 #GeneralElections2019 #IndiaElections2019 #UnfoldingIndianElections pic.twitter.com/1SPIRAuSJ6

— PIB India (@PIB_India) April 11, 2019

Coochbehar: The people in queue in Dinahata sub-division of Coochbehar district are voting as Indian citizens for the first time. The Enclave Settlement with Bangladesh had added 9,776 “new Indians” to #WestBengal’s voter list in 2015 https://t.co/zPNtNFdyVA

— ANI (@ANI) April 11, 2019

details.title: A bridegroom casts his vote at a polling station in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor
Maoist fear mars polling in Malkangiri
details.content: No polling was recorded in 15 booths in Odisha's Malkangiri district due to Maoist fear. In the neighbouring district of Kalahandi, scores of people boycotted polling protesting lack of development.

Uttarakhand: Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) & VVPAT being packed at a polling station in Haldwani after voting there concludes. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/CxMTjvOCA4

— ANI (@ANI) April 11, 2019

details.content: Polling officers packing the EVM machines and VVPAT at Government Primary school in Kachiguda (Photo |Vinay Madapu)

Bihar: Visuals from Jamui where the EVMs and VVPATs are being taken to the strong room as the polling for the first phase of Lok Sabha Elections has concluded there. #IndiaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/EUZMNx8Jog

details.title: These Odisha villagers boycott first phase of LS elections as they do not have proper roads
details.content: Residents of Bhejipadar village in Kalahandi district boycotted the first phase of Lok Sabha elections 2019, today alleging that they are still awaiting a proper road connectivity to their village despite complaining to the administration since 2017.
